Class PIDController

java.lang.Object
MRILib.motion.PIDController
public class PIDController extends Object
Manages three independent PID controllers (for X, Y, and Theta/Heading) to guide a robot towards a target
invalid reference 
Pose2D
using field-centric control.

This controller version calculates field-relative X, Y, and Theta PID outputs. It then directly passes these outputs (scaled by maxSpeed and maxAngSpeed) to the Bot.driveFieldXYW(double, double, double) method. The driveFieldXYW method is responsible for handling the necessary coordinate transformations and Mecanum kinematics to achieve the desired field-centric movement and rotation.

Maximum speeds can be set dynamically using Supplier objects.

See Also:
  • PID
  • Bot.driveFieldXYW(double, double, double)
  • invalid reference 
    Pose2D
  • Supplier

    • maxAngSpeed

      public Supplier<Double> maxAngSpeed
      Supplier for the maximum allowable angular (rotational) speed component. Allows dynamic speed limits. Defaults to a supplier returning 0.6.

    • maxSpeed

      public Supplier<Double> maxSpeed
      Supplier for the maximum allowable translational speed component. Allows dynamic speed limits. Defaults to a supplier returning 0.5 in the constructor.

    • POWER_SCALE

      public double POWER_SCALE
      Scaling factor for power, declared but currently unused.

      Flag, declared but apparently unused in the current implementation.

  • Constructor Details

    • PIDController

      public PIDController(Bot bot, org.firstinspires.ftc.robotcore.external.Telemetry telemetry)
      Constructs a PIDController associated with a generic Bot. Initializes maxSpeed supplier to return 0.5 by default.
      Parameters:
      bot - The Bot instance providing hardware access (odometry, motors).
      telemetry - The Telemetry instance for outputting debug data.

  • Method Details

    • setPID

      public void setPID(PID x, PID y)
      Sets the PID controllers for the X and Y axes (translational).
      Parameters:
      x - The PID instance for X-axis control.
      y - The PID instance for Y-axis control.

    • setTurnPID

      public void setTurnPID(PID theta)
      Sets the PID controller for the Theta (heading/turn) axis. Consider using HeadingPID if this PID directly controls absolute heading to handle angle wrapping correctly within the PID update.
      Parameters:
      theta - The PID instance for rotational control.

    • start

      public void start()
      Initializes the PID controllers. Resets the internal state (integral sum, last error) of the X, Y, and Theta PIDs. Sets the initial target for the Theta PID based on the last call to `moveTo` (or 0 initially).

    • update

      public void update()
      Updates the PID controllers and commands the robot using field-centric drive.

      1. Reads the current robot pose (X, Y, Heading). 2. Updates the X, Y, and Theta PIDs based on the current pose and their respective targets. 3. Retrieves the maximum speed limits from the suppliers. 4. Normalizes the translational PID outputs (X, Y) if their combined magnitude exceeds 1.0. 5. Calls Bot.driveFieldXYW(double, double, double) with the scaled, field-centric X, Y, and Theta PID outputs.

    • moveTo

      public void moveTo(double x, double y, double degrees)
      Sets the target pose for the PID controllers. Updates the target values for the X, Y, and Theta PIDs directly.
      Parameters:
      x - The target X-coordinate (inches) on the field.
      y - The target Y-coordinate (inches) on the field.
      degrees - The target heading (degrees) relative to the field.

    • setMaxSpeed

      public void setMaxSpeed(double s)
      Sets the maximum translational speed limit using a simple supplier.
      Parameters:
      s - The maximum speed multiplier (0.0 to 1.0).

    • setMaxAngSpeed

      public void setMaxAngSpeed(double s)
      Sets the maximum angular (rotational) speed limit using a simple supplier.
      Parameters:
      s - The maximum angular speed multiplier (0.0 to 1.0).

    • getTargetX

      public double getTargetX()
      Gets the current target X-coordinate set by moveTo(double, double, double).
      Returns:
      The target X-coordinate (inches).

    • getTargetY

      public double getTargetY()
      Gets the current target Y-coordinate set by moveTo(double, double, double).
      Returns:
      The target Y-coordinate (inches).

    • getTargetRadians

      public double getTargetRadians()
      Gets the current target heading set by moveTo(double, double, double).
      Returns:
      The target heading in radians.

    • getTargetDegrees

      public double getTargetDegrees()
      Gets the current target heading in degrees. Converts the internal radian target back to degrees. Note: The original negation is removed as targets seem direct now. Verify consistency.
      Returns:
      The target heading in degrees.

    • getCurrentDegrees

      public double getCurrentDegrees()
      Gets the robot's current heading in degrees, based on odometry. Note: The original negation is kept, assuming the odometry reading or coordinate system requires it for the desired output convention. Verify this convention.
      Returns:
      The current heading in degrees (potentially negated).

    • getCurrentRadians

      public double getCurrentRadians()
      Gets the robot's current heading in radians, based on odometry. Note: The original negation is kept, assuming the odometry reading or coordinate system requires it for the desired output convention. Verify this convention.
      Returns:
      The current heading in radians (potentially negated).
